meta.name: 12th Fail
meta.description: The real-life story of IPS Officer Manoj Kumar Sharma and IRS Officer Shraddha Joshi.

review.name: An excellent watch. Made for everyone
review.reviewBody:
Superlative acting by each person in the movie, even those playing much smaller roles. The fact that it is based on a true story makes you really understand and appreciate what the person went through and how he achieved it. Dadi is awesome 😎

Vikrant Massey plays the character with such ease. Do read how he prepared for the movie. It reminds me of Aamir Khan. Medha Shankar, Anshumaan Pushkar, Anant Joshi have portrayed their roles beautifully.

The storyline flows effortlessly from the beginning and the narration by Anant is superb. What you also live through is the hard work that people put in while preparing for the UPSC exams, especially those coming from far flung villages of the country.

A movie that you would definitely want the kids in the family to see. Congratulations to the entire cast and crew. You have delivered a masterpiece !

plotText.plainText: The real-life story of IPS Officer Manoj Kumar Sharma and IRS Officer Shraddha Joshi.

text.plaidHtml:
This film went through an extensive casting process. At least 35+ actors were tested for every one of the chief characters - Shraddha Joshi, Pritam Pandey, Gauri Bhaiya, Ranveer, Pushpa, Dadi.

The only character for which only one actor was tested was Manoj.
When Shraddha says "I love you" back to Manoj, it is supposed to be 2AM. Right after that Manoj runs to Deep Mohan's home where all employees are present and working.

lines.text: If citizens were educated, it could be a real problem for leaders.

text.plaidHtml: In cinematic version of the movie there's a scene where Shraddha kisses Manoj ,before his interview, which was replaced in the OTT version
